info.name: Test comments
info.description:
# Soft Desk API

## Overview

Soft Desk API is a back-end application to be executed locally in the context of OpenClassroom educational project. 
It allow registered users to report and follow project related issues.
Registered users can create projects, add project contributors, create project issues and create issue comments.
This application has been developed with the Django rest framework, using SQlite database.

## Local server installation and usage

Please refer to the application README.md for application installation and usage.

## Error codes

**404**: One of the id request (stored in variables `project_id`, `user_id`, `issue_id` or `comment_id`) refer to a non existant object.

request.description:
Login as a previously registered user.

### Expected fields in request body

- **username** : Username of the previously registered user.
- **password** : Password of the previously registered user.

### Keys returned in response body

- **refresh** : Refresh token to be used for refreshing login end point. The value is automatically assigned to the collection variable `token_refresh`.
- **access** : Access token to be used for authentification. The value is automatically assigned to the collection variable `token`.

Refresh access for previously logged user.

### Expected fields in request body

- **refresh** : Refresh token value of the previously logged user.

### Keys returned in response body

- **access** : Access token to be used for authentification. The value is automatically assigned to the collection variable `token`.

List all projects from wich current user is an assigned contributor or author.
The collection variable `project_id` is automatically set as the 1st project id in the list (this value can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated.

### Keys returned in response body

List of project with following data :
- **id** : Id number of project.
- **title** : Title of the new project.
- **description** : Description of the new project.
- **type** : Type of the new project: accepted values are `back-end`, `front-end`, `iOS` or `Android`.

List all issues of the project with id `project_id`.
The collection variable `project_id` is automatically set as the 1st project id in the list when the request list projects is called (this value can be override in the collection tab if needed).
The collection variable `issue_id` is automatically set as the 1st issue id in the list (this value can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated and must be a contributor or the author of the project.

### Keys returned in response body

List of issues with following data :
- **id** : Id number of the issue.
- **title** : Title of the issue.
- **desc** : Description of the issue.
- **tag** : Tag of the issues: values are `bug`, `improvement` or `task`.
- **priority** : Issue priority: values are `low`, `medium` or `high`.
- **status** : Issue status: values are `to_do`, `on_going` or `done`.
- **author_user** : Id number of the author user.
- **assigned_user** : Id number of the assigned user.
- **created_time** : Date and hour of the issue creation or last update.

Create a new comment to the issue with id `issue_id`, related to project with id `issue_id`.
The collection variables `project_id`/`issue_id` are automatically set as the 1st item id in the list when the request list projects/issues is called (the values can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated and must be a contributor or the author of the project.

### Expected fields in request body

- **description** : Comment description.

List all comments related to the issue with id `issue_id`.
The collection variables `project_id`/`issue_id` are automatically set as the 1st item id in the list when the request list projects/issues is called (the values can be override in the collection tab if needed).
The collection variable `comment_id` is automatically set as the 1st comment id in the list (this value can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated and must be a contributor or the author of the project.

### Keys returned in response body

List of comments with following data :
- **id** : Id number of the comment.
- **description** : Description of the comment.
- **author_user** : Id number of the author user.
- **issue** : Id number of the related issue.
- **created_time** : Date and hour of the comment creation or last update.

Update the comment with id `comment_id`.
The collection variables `project_id`/`issue_id` are automatically set as the 1st item id in the list when the request list projects/issues is called (the values can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated and must be  the author of the comment.

### Expected fields in request body

- **description** : Comment description.

Delete comment with id `comment_id`. The collection variables `project_id`/`issue_id` are automatically set as the 1st item id in the list when the request list projects/issues is called (the values can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

Requires bearer token authentification (value is stored in collection variable `token` during login.

### Permission
The user must be authenticated and must be  the author of the comment.

### Response

If delete operation is successful, the code 201 is returned.

Retrive data from comment with id `comment_id`. The collection variables `project_id`/`issue_id` are automatically set as the 1st item id in the list when the request list projects/issues is called (the values can be override in the collection tab if needed).

### Authentification

- **description** : Description of the comment.
- **author_user** : Id number of the author user.
- **issue** : Id number of the related issue.
- **created_time** : Date and hour of the comment creation or last update.
